result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael S. Ware was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct - Domestic Abuse Repeater [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Repeater, Repeater], an unclassified felony, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Bond from 15CF531 applied  -  PAID IN FULL.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  
*  Pay supervision fees.  
Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.  
*  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.  
*  Bond from 15CF531 applied.    
*  Defendant ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice was given.  
Cooperate with the Child Support Agency to establish paternity and/or to pay child support and make all court appearances in any paternity action.  May not have contact with Ebony Gaines, unless otherwise permitted by the court.

supervisions.notes:
PROBATION REVOKED  -  CONCURRENT TO 15CF531 & 15CF909
***JOC IS AMENDED to show credit for time served ***

superMiscConds.notes:
Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  
*  Pay supervision fees.  
Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by agent.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.  
*  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.  
*  Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.    
*  If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.
Cooperate with the Child Support Agency to establish paternity and/or to pay child support and make all court appearances in any paternity action.  May not have contact with Ebony Gaines or Ashley Wells, unless otherwise permitted by the court only.

supervisions.notes: ANY UNPAID COURT OBLIGATIONS ARE STILL TO BE COLLECTED

3 yrs WSP; 2 yrs Initial followed by 1 yr ES.  Not eligible for CIP or SAP

State appears by Special Prosecutor Lara Parker. Defendant, Michael S. Ware, appeared in custody with Attorney Ryan Ogren.   Clerk: PT
Court advises parties after reviewing file the substitution that filed at the initial in 15CF411 was never brought to this court's attention and appears to have not been addressed at arraignment before Comm. Mason as reflected in court record.  DE advises he withdraws that prior substitution request. Sentencing arguments made.   DE is sentenced to 3 years in the WSP forthwith. 2 years Initial Confinement followed by 1 year of Extended Supervision.  Credit for 259 days.  (15CF411, 15CF531 and 15CF909 are Concurrent)  Costs still remaining to be paid during extended supervision. DE is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Substance Abuse Program.   No contact with Ebony G. or Ashley W. unless otherwise permitted by the court only.   Appeal Rights given.

Attorney Emily Trigg appeared for the State.  Def. appeared with Atty Jodi Meier.  Clerk K. Zirbel.  Count 1 - Sentence withheld, placed on probation for 3 year w/conditions.  Conditions include no contact with victim E.G.  Defendant is ordered to submit a DNA sample; written notice provided to defendant.  Cash bond in 15CF531 to apply to costs due.

15CF411, 15CF531 & 15CF909 - Attorney Emily Trigg appeared for the State.  Def. appeared (in custody) with Atty Jodi Meier.  Clerk K. Zirbel.  Case set for sentencing hearing today.  One of the victims was present on 1/20/16 when case was originally set for sentencing, but she is unable to be present at today's hearing.  Sentencing adj. to 2/12/16 at 10:30.  Bond continued in 15CF411 and 15CF531.  15CF909 - Bond modified to $5,000.00 signature with same conditions.
